item.title: Developer Testing: How I learned to stop worrying and start testing
item.description: “Why do I need testing? I write code with little or no bugs”, “I tested my code! when I wrote it” or “Isn’t it QA’s responsibility?” are all sayings some of us make regarding testing. Sure, testing is an annoyance no developer wants to deal with.. after all, we’re not quality assurance engineers. We write the code, the features, the business logic. And maybe they’re even right. If you must deliver as soon as possible, it’s easier to leave formality aside, crunch the code real fast, deliver and move to the next challenge.
